L2_gloss:
a letter used in the Romanisation:
of ㇲ
欠伸 あふつㇲ (afutsɿ, “yawn”) — [1]
月 つㇲくㇲ (tskɿ, “moon”) — [2]
薬 ふすㇲ (fusuɿ, “drug”) — [3]
of ㇲ゙
ㇲ゙ざら (ɿzara, “sickle”) — [4]
肘 ぴづㇲ゙ (pidzɿ, “elbow”) — [5]
of ㇽ
ぱびㇽ (pabiɿ, “butterfly”) — [6]
geta: a kind of wooden clog with at least one, more commonly two, stilts or “teeth”
Alternative form of 沖縄口 (“Okinawan language”)
寝汗: sweat created while sleeping
Pāntu, supernatural beings wearing masks that spread sacred mud to people
Alternative form of 我ん達 (ばんたー, bantā, “we, us, ourselves”)
波布, 蛇: snake, viper, Okinawan habu
aunt (older or younger than one’s parent)
Alternative form of 宮古口 (“Miyako language”)
branch (of a tree or plant); bough
